February 28, 1952
Mr. Burton P&ulu
Secretary, HAEB
KUOM, University of Minnesota
Minneapolis, Minnesota
Dear Burton:
Please see attached letter from Television
Digest. I now raise some questions. Xou understand,
s'ir, that I»m simply raising questions; 1‘m not
objecting to anything. If we subscribe, should it be
for (A), (B), or (O? And, no matter which, do
you still think it worth it for HAEB? And even if
you do, would it not be wise to bring the matter
up for discussion with executive committee again?
Hot that it hasn*t technically been decided, but
because of the sum involved? Or, do you feel the
matter is more urgent, and X should proceed to
order?
Related to the question of which part of ser¬
vice, (A), (B), or (G), might be Just parts what
headquarters will be getting.
Again, sir, no objections; I*m Just raising
questions.
Regards,
FESjfmh
Frank E. Schooley
Station Manager
